participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

subjectkey.Description: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject

src_subject_id.Description: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project

interview_date.Description: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

interview_age.Description: Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging. | Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

sex.Description: Sex of subject at birth | M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

crpbi_parent1_y.Description: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol). Makes me feel better after talking over my worries with him/her | 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

crpbi_parent2_y.Description: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Smiles at me very often. | 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

crpbi_parent3_y.Description: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Is able to make me feel better when I am upset. | 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

crpbi_parent4_y.Description: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Believes in showing his/her love for me. | 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

crpbi_parent5_y.Description: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Is easy to talk to. | 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

crpbi_caregiver1_y.Description: Is there a second adult who cares for you, that you spend a significant amount of time with, like your other parent, step-parent, grandparent, aunt or uncle? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

crpbi_caregiver2_y.Description: Who is the second caregiver? If more than one caregiver, choose the person you spend the most time with. | 1 = mother; 2 = father; 3 = grandmother; 4 = grandfather; 5 = aunt; 6 = uncle; 7 = other

crpbi_caregiver12_y.Description: Makes me feel better after talking over my worries with them. | 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

crpbi_caregiver13_y.Description: Second caregiver. Smiles at me very often. | 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

crpbi_caregiver14_y.Description: Second caregiver. Is able to make me feel better when I am upset. | 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

crpbi_caregiver15_y.Description: Believes in showing their love for me. | 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

crpbi_caregiver16_y.Description: Second caregiver. Is easy to talk to. | 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

eventname.Description: The event name for which the data was collected

crpbi_studycaregiver_id.Description: Who is the caregiver that is participating in the study with you today? | 1 = mother; 2 = father; 3 = grandmother; 4 = grandfather; 5 = aunt; 6 = uncle; 7 = other
